info.title: Google Cloud Testing API
info.description: Allows developers to run automated tests for their mobile applications on Google infrastructure.

get.description:
Get the catalog of supported test environments.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the environment type does not exist
- INTERNAL - if an internal error occurred

parameters.name: environmentType
parameters.description:
The type of environment that should be listed.
Required (Acceptable values are: "ENVIRONMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED", "ANDROID", "NETWORK_CONFIGURATION")

parameters.name: upload_protocol
parameters.description: Upload protocol for media (e.g. "raw", "multipart").

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: uploadType
parameters.description: Legacy upload protocol for media (e.g. "media", "multipart").

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: $.xgafv
parameters.description: V1 error format. (Acceptable values are: "1", "2")

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: JSONP

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Data format for response. (Acceptable values are: "json", "media", "proto")

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: OAuth access token.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

parameters.name: pp
parameters.description: Pretty-print response.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: bearer_token
parameters.description: OAuth bearer token.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description:
For authorization, the cloud project requesting the TestEnvironmentCatalog.
Optional

post.description:
Cancels unfinished test executions in a test matrix.
This call returns immediately and cancellation proceeds asychronously.
If the matrix is already final, this operation will have no effect.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the Test Matrix does not exist

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Cloud project that owns the test.

parameters.name: testMatrixId
parameters.description: Test matrix that will be canceled.

parameters.name: upload_protocol
parameters.description: Upload protocol for media (e.g. "raw", "multipart").

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: uploadType
parameters.description: Legacy upload protocol for media (e.g. "media", "multipart").

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: $.xgafv
parameters.description: V1 error format. (Acceptable values are: "1", "2")

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: JSONP

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Data format for response. (Acceptable values are: "json", "media", "proto")

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: OAuth access token.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

parameters.name: pp
parameters.description: Pretty-print response.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: bearer_token
parameters.description: OAuth bearer token.

get.description:
Check the status of a test matrix.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the Test Matrix does not exist

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Cloud project that owns the test matrix.

parameters.name: testMatrixId
parameters.description: Unique test matrix id which was assigned by the service.

parameters.name: upload_protocol
parameters.description: Upload protocol for media (e.g. "raw", "multipart").

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: uploadType
parameters.description: Legacy upload protocol for media (e.g. "media", "multipart").

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: $.xgafv
parameters.description: V1 error format. (Acceptable values are: "1", "2")

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: JSONP

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Data format for response. (Acceptable values are: "json", "media", "proto")

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: OAuth access token.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

parameters.name: pp
parameters.description: Pretty-print response.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: bearer_token
parameters.description: OAuth bearer token.

post.description:
Request to run a matrix of tests according to the given specifications.
Unsupported environments will be returned in the state UNSUPPORTED.
Matrices are limited to at most 200 supported executions.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to write to project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed or if the matrix expands
                     to more than 200 supported executions

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The GCE project under which this job will run.

parameters.name: upload_protocol
parameters.description: Upload protocol for media (e.g. "raw", "multipart").

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: uploadType
parameters.description: Legacy upload protocol for media (e.g. "media", "multipart").

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: $.xgafv
parameters.description: V1 error format. (Acceptable values are: "1", "2")

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: JSONP

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Data format for response. (Acceptable values are: "json", "media", "proto")

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: OAuth access token.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

parameters.name: pp
parameters.description: Pretty-print response.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: bearer_token
parameters.description: OAuth bearer token.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description:
A string id used to detect duplicated requests.
Ids are automatically scoped to a project, so
users should ensure the ID is unique per-project.
A UUID is recommended.

Optional, but strongly recommended.

TestSetup.title: TestSetup

networkProfile.description:
The network traffic profile used for running the test.
Optional

environmentVariables.description:
Environment variables to set for the test (only applicable for
instrumentation tests).

account.description:
The device will be logged in on this account for the duration of the test.
Optional

directoriesToPull.description:
List of directories on the device to upload to GCS at the end of the test;
they must be absolute paths under /sdcard or /data/local/tmp.
Path names are restricted to characters a-z A-Z 0-9 _ - . + and /

Note: The paths /sdcard and /data will be made available and treated as
implicit path substitutions. E.g. if /sdcard on a particular device does
not map to external storage, the system will replace it with the external
storage path prefix for that device.

Optional

filesToPush.description:
List of files to push to the device before starting the test.

Optional

TestSetup.description: A description of how to set up the device prior to running the test

TestSpecification.title: TestSpecification

testTimeout.description:
Max time a test execution is allowed to run before it is
automatically cancelled.
Optional, default is 5 min.

autoGoogleLogin.description:
Enables automatic Google account login.
If set, the service will automatically generate a Google test account and
add it to the device, before executing the test. Note that test accounts
might be reused.
Many applications show their full set of functionalities when an account is
present on the device. Logging into the device with these generated
accounts allows testing more functionalities.
Default is false.
Optional

testSetup.description:
Test setup requirements e.g. files to install, bootstrap scripts
Optional

androidTestLoop.description: An Android Application with a Test Loop

disablePerformanceMetrics.description: Disables performance metrics recording; may reduce test latency.

disableVideoRecording.description: Disables video recording; may reduce test latency.

TestSpecification.description: A description of how to run the test.

ResultStorage.title: ResultStorage

toolResultsExecution.description:
The tool results execution that results are written to.
@OutputOnly

toolResultsHistory.description:
The tool results history that contains the tool results execution that
results are written to.

Optional, if not provided the service will choose an appropriate value.

ResultStorage.description: Locations where the results of running the test are stored.

TestMatrix.title: TestMatrix

timestamp.description:
The time this test matrix was initially created.
@OutputOnly

environmentMatrix.description:
How the host machine(s) are configured.
Required

testMatrixId.description:
Unique id set by the service.
@OutputOnly

resultStorage.description:
Where the results for the matrix are written.
Required

state.description:
Indicates the current progress of the test matrix (e.g., FINISHED)
@OutputOnly

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the test matrix.
@OutputOnly

testSpecification.description:
How to run the test.
Required

clientInfo.description:
Information about the client which invoked the test.
Optional

testExecutions.description:
The list of test executions that the service creates for this matrix.
@OutputOnly

TestMatrix.description:
A group of one or more TestExecutions, built by taking a
product of values over a pre-defined set of axes.

AndroidVersion.title: AndroidVersion

releaseDate.description:
The date this Android version became available in the market.
@OutputOnly

AndroidVersion.description: A version of the Android OS

FileReference.title: FileReference

gcsPath.description:
A path to a file in Google Cloud Storage.
Example: gs://build-app-1414623860166/app-debug-unaligned.apk

FileReference.description: A reference to a file, used for user inputs.

TestDetails.title: TestDetails

progressMessages.description:
Human-readable, detailed descriptions of the test's progress.
For example: "Provisioning a device", "Starting Test".

During the course of execution new data may be appended
to the end of progress_messages.
@OutputOnly

TestDetails.description: Additional details about the progress of the running test.

ToolResultsExecution.title: ToolResultsExecution

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the tool results execution.
@OutputOnly

ToolResultsExecution.description:
Represents a tool results execution resource.

This has the results of a TestMatrix.

ToolResultsHistory.title: ToolResultsHistory

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the tool results history.
Required

historyId.description:
A tool results history ID.
Required

ToolResultsHistory.description: Represents a tool results history resource.

AndroidRoboTest.title: AndroidRoboTest

maxDepth.description:
The max depth of the traversal stack Robo can explore. Needs to be at least
2 to make Robo explore the app beyond the first activity.
Default is 50.
Optional

appApk.description:
The APK for the application under test.
Required

appPackageId.description:
The java package for the application under test.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

startingIntents.description:
The intents used to launch the app for the crawl.
If none are provided, then the main launcher activity is launched.
If some are provided, then only those provided are launched (the main
launcher activity must be provided explicitly).

maxSteps.description:
The max number of steps Robo can execute.
Default is no limit.
Optional

appInitialActivity.description:
The initial activity that should be used to start the app.
Optional

roboDirectives.description:
A set of directives Robo should apply during the crawl.
This allows users to customize the crawl. For example, the username and
password for a test account can be provided.
Optional

AndroidRoboTest.description:
A test of an android application that explores the application on a virtual
or physical Android Device, finding culprits and crashes as it goes.

Distribution.title: Distribution

marketShare.description:
The estimated fraction (0-1) of the total market with this configuration.
@OutputOnly

measurementTime.description:
The time this distribution was measured.
@OutputOnly

Distribution.description:
Data about the relative number of devices running a
given configuration of the Android platform.

AndroidTestLoop.title: AndroidTestLoop

scenarios.description:
The list of scenarios that should be run during the test.
Optional, default is all test loops, derived from the application's
manifest.

scenarioLabels.description:
The list of scenario labels that should be run during the test.
The scenario labels should map to labels defined in the application's
manifest. For example, player_experience and
com.google.test.loops.player_experience add all of the loops labeled in the
manifest with the com.google.test.loops.player_experience name to the
execution.
Optional. Scenarios can also be specified in the scenarios field.

appApk.description:
The APK for the application under test.
Required

appPackageId.description:
The java package for the application under test.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

AndroidTestLoop.description:
A test of an Android Application with a Test Loop.
The intent <intent-name> will be implicitly added, since Games is the only
user of this api, for the time being.

models.description:
The set of supported Android device models.
@OutputOnly

versions.description:
The set of supported Android OS versions.
@OutputOnly

runtimeConfiguration.description:
The set of supported runtime configurations.
@OutputOnly

AndroidDeviceList.title: AndroidDeviceList

androidDevices.description:
A list of Android devices
Required

AndroidDeviceList.description: A list of Android device configurations in which the test is to be executed.

ClientInfo.title: ClientInfo

clientInfoDetails.description: The list of detailed information about client.

name.description:
Client name, such as gcloud.
Required

ClientInfo.description: Information about the client which invoked the test.

EnvironmentMatrix.title: EnvironmentMatrix

androidDeviceList.description:
A list of Android devices; the test will be run only on the specified
devices.

EnvironmentMatrix.description: The matrix of environments in which the test is to be executed.

Date20.title: Date20

year.description:
Year of date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 if specifying a date without
a year.

day.description:
Day of month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and month, or 0
if specifying a year/month where the day is not significant.

month.description: Month of year. Must be from 1 to 12.

Date20.description:
Represents a whole calendar date, e.g. date of birth. The time of day and
time zone are either specified elsewhere or are not significant. The date
is relative to the Proleptic Gregorian Calendar. The day may be 0 to
represent a year and month where the day is not significant, e.g. credit card
expiration date. The year may be 0 to represent a month and day independent
of year, e.g. anniversary date. Related types are google.type.TimeOfDay
and `google.protobuf.Timestamp`.

CancelTestMatrixResponse.title: CancelTestMatrixResponse

testState.description:
The current rolled-up state of the test matrix.
If this state is already final, then the cancelation request will
have no effect.

CancelTestMatrixResponse.description: Response containing the current state of the specified test matrix.

RoboStartingIntent.title: RoboStartingIntent
RoboStartingIntent.description: Message for specifying the start activities to crawl

StartActivityIntent.title: StartActivityIntent

categories.description:
Intent categories to set on the intent.
Optional.

StartActivityIntent.description: A starting intent specified by an action, uri, and categories.

Account.title: Account
Account.description: Identifies an account and how to log into it

TestEnvironmentCatalog.title: TestEnvironmentCatalog

androidDeviceCatalog.description: Android devices suitable for running Android Instrumentation Tests.

TestEnvironmentCatalog.description: A description of a test environment.

region.description:
A human-friendly string representing the region for this locale.
Example: "United States"
Not present for every locale.
@OutputOnly

ObbFile.title: ObbFile

obb.description:
Opaque Binary Blob (OBB) file(s) to install on the device
Required

obbFileName.description:
OBB file name which must conform to the format as specified by
Android
e.g. [main|patch].0300110.com.example.android.obb
which will be installed into
  <shared-storage>/Android/obb/<package-name>/
on the device
Required

ObbFile.description: An opaque binary blob file to install on the device before the test starts

AndroidRuntimeConfiguration.title: AndroidRuntimeConfiguration
AndroidRuntimeConfiguration.description: Configuration that can be selected at the time a test is run.

orientation.description:
How the device is oriented during the test.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

locale.description:
The locale the test device used for testing.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

androidModelId.description:
The id of the Android device to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

androidVersionId.description:
The id of the Android OS version to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

id.description:
The unique opaque id for this network traffic configuration
@OutputOnly

upRule.description: The emulation rule applying to the upload traffic

downRule.description: The emulation rule applying to the download traffic

ToolResultsStep.title: ToolResultsStep

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the tool results step.
@OutputOnly

ToolResultsStep.description:
Represents a tool results step resource.

This has the results of a TestExecution.

AndroidInstrumentationTest.title: AndroidInstrumentationTest

testApk.description:
The APK containing the test code to be executed.
Required

testRunnerClass.description:
The InstrumentationTestRunner class.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

testPackageId.description:
The java package for the test to be executed.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

appPackageId.description:
The java package for the application under test.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

appApk.description:
The APK for the application under test.
Required

orchestratorOption.description:
The option of whether running each test within its own invocation of
instrumentation with Android Test Orchestrator or not.
** Orchestrator is only compatible with AndroidJUnitRunner version 1.0 or
higher! **
Orchestrator offers the following benefits:
 - No shared state
 - Crashes are isolated
 - Logs are scoped per test

See
<https://developer.android.com/training/testing/junit-runner.html#using-android-test-orchestrator>
for more information about Android Test Orchestrator.

Optional, if empty, test will be run without orchestrator.

testTargets.description:
Each target must be fully qualified with the package name or class name,
in one of these formats:
 - "package package_name"
 - "class package_name.class_name"
 - "class package_name.class_name#method_name"

Optional, if empty, all targets in the module will be run.

AndroidInstrumentationTest.description:
A test of an Android application that can control an Android component
independently of its normal lifecycle.
Android instrumentation tests run an application APK and test APK inside the
same process on a virtual or physical AndroidDevice.  They also specify
a test runner class, such as com.google.GoogleTestRunner, which can vary
on the specific instrumentation framework chosen.

See <http://developer.android.com/tools/testing/testing_android.html> for
more information on types of Android tests.

obbFile.description: A reference to an opaque binary blob file

ClientInfoDetail.title: ClientInfoDetail

key.description:
The key of detailed client information.
Required

value.description:
The value of detailed client information.
Required

ClientInfoDetail.description:
Key-value pair of detailed information about the client which invoked the
test. For example {'Version', '1.0'}, {'Release Track', 'BETA'}

EnvironmentVariable.title: EnvironmentVariable
EnvironmentVariable.description: A key-value pair passed as an environment variable to the test

Environment.title: Environment

androidDevice.description: An Android device which must be used with an Android test.

Environment.description: The environment in which the test is run.

GoogleCloudStorage.title: GoogleCloudStorage

gcsPath.description:
The path to a directory in GCS that will
eventually contain the results for this test.
The requesting user must have write access on the bucket in the supplied
path.
Required

GoogleCloudStorage.description: A storage location within Google cloud storage (GCS).

TestExecution.title: TestExecution

testDetails.description:
Additional details about the running test.
@OutputOnly

environment.description:
How the host machine(s) are configured.
@OutputOnly

state.description:
Indicates the current progress of the test execution (e.g., FINISHED).
@OutputOnly

toolResultsStep.description:
Where the results for this execution are written.
@OutputOnly

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the test execution.
@OutputOnly

id.description:
Unique id set by the backend.
@OutputOnly

timestamp.description:
The time this test execution was initially created.
@OutputOnly

TestExecution.description: Specifies a single test to be executed in a single environment.

RoboDirective.title: RoboDirective

resourceName.description:
The android resource name of the target UI element
For example,
   in Java: R.string.foo
   in xml: @string/foo
Only the “foo” part is needed.
Reference doc:
https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/accessing-resources.html
Required

inputText.description:
The text that Robo is directed to set. If left empty, the directive will be
treated as a CLICK on the element matching the resource_name.
Optional

actionType.description:
The type of action that Robo should perform on the specified element.
Required.

RoboDirective.description:
Directs Robo to interact with a specific UI element if it is encountered
during the crawl. Currently, Robo can perform text entry or element click.

AndroidMatrix.title: AndroidMatrix

orientations.description:
The set of orientations to test with.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

androidVersionIds.description:
The ids of the set of Android OS version to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

locales.description:
The set of locales the test device will enable for testing.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

androidModelIds.description:
The ids of the set of Android device to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

AndroidMatrix.description:
A set of Android device configuration permutations is defined by the
the cross-product of the given axes.  Internally, the given AndroidMatrix
will be expanded into a set of AndroidDevices.

Only supported permutations will be instantiated.  Invalid permutations
(e.g., incompatible models/versions) are ignored.

AndroidModel.title: AndroidModel

supportedAbis.description:
The list of supported ABIs for this device.
This corresponds to either android.os.Build.SUPPORTED_ABIS (for API level
21 and above) or android.os.Build.CPU_ABI/CPU_ABI2.
The most preferred ABI is the first element in the list.

Elements are optionally prefixed by "version_id:" (where version_id is
the id of an AndroidVersion), denoting an ABI that is supported only on
a particular version.
@OutputOnly

screenX.description:
Screen size in the horizontal (X) dimension measured in pixels.
@OutputOnly

screenY.description:
Screen size in the vertical (Y) dimension measured in pixels.
@OutputOnly

form.description:
Whether this device is virtual or physical.
@OutputOnly

supportedVersionIds.description:
The set of Android versions this device supports.
@OutputOnly

AndroidModel.description: A description of an Android device tests may be run on.
